document.masterDocTitle: Three new species of the genus Barsine Walker (Lepidoptera: Erebidae: Arctiinae) from Taiwan

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Three new species of the genus Barsine Walker (Lepidoptera: Erebidae: Arctiinae) from Taiwan

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Altai State University, Lenina Avenue, 61, RF- 656049, Barnaul, Russia

bibRefCitation.author: Wu, S. & Fu, C. - M. & Chang, W. - C. & Shih, L. - C.
bibRefCitation.refString: Wu, S., Fu, C. - M., Chang, W. - C. & Shih, L. - C. (2013) Arctiinae. In: Fu, C. - M., Ronkay, L. & Lin, H. - H. (Eds.), Moths of Hehuanshan. Endemic Species Research Institute, Nantou, pp. 308 - 333.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material examined .
Photographs of the
holotype
( Fig. 14 ): male, “Mingchih (
1050m
), Ilan Co. , Taiwan
17- IV-2012
S. Wu & W.C. Chang ” / red label “ Holotype
Barsine callorufa Wu, Fu & Chang, 2013
” / barcode label with a unique number “00145711” ( TFRI ).

Diagnosis . The forewing length is 18–18.5 mm in males and 21–22 mm in females. The detailed comparison with the externally similar
B. witti
sp. n.
is provided above in the diagnosis of the latter species.
Distribution . Endemic to Taiwan Island . Known from Nantou, Taitung, Pingtung, Ilan and Hualien Counties.

Remark . The male genitalia of
B. callorufa
illustrated by
Wu et al. (2013)
and subsequently by Volynkin & Černý (2017 : fig. 21) belong to the paratype (slide No. TFRI146149) and not the holotype as they were erroneously marked by Volynkin & Černý (2017) .
